net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher

Class AbstractFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher.AbstractFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Fetcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBufferedFetcher

    public abstract class AbstractFetcher
extends Object
implements Fetcher
    AbstractFetcher is a sensible base implementation of Fetcher.

    Implementers must only implement a single simplified method that copies all bytes from an InputStream to an OutputStream: doCopy(InputStream, OutputStream, FetchProgressListener).

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

        public final byte[] fetch(InputStream in)
                   throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: Fetcher
        Fetches the content of a given InputStream into a fresh byte[].

        See Fetcher.copy(InputStream, OutputStream, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Specified by:
        fetch in interface Fetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        Returns:
        A new byte[], containing the content of the given InputStream.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given InputStream.

      • copy

        public final void copy(InputStream in,
                       OutputStream out,
                       boolean closeIn,
                       boolean closeOut)
                throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: Fetcher
        Copies the content of a given InputStream into a given OutputStream.

        Missing or invalid arguments are handled gracefully with the following behaviour.

        A null is given as an InputStream, it is simply ignored and handled as if there was nothing to read. If closeOut is true, the given OutputStream will be closed anyway

        A null is given as an OutputStream, it is simply ignored, but the content of given InputStream is fetched anyway. If closeIn is true, the given InputStream will be closed anyway

        Specified by:
        copy in interface Fetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        out - The OutputStream to write to.
        closeIn - Whether to close the given InputStream, after reading from it.
        closeOut - Whether to close the given OutputStream, after writing to it.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given InputStream or writing to the given OutputStream. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close one of the given streams, if requested, are ignored.

      • copy

        public final void copy(InputStream in,
                       OutputStream out,
                       FetchProgressListener listener)
                throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: Fetcher

      • copy

        public final void copy(InputStream in,
                       OutputStream out,
                       FetchProgressListener listener,
                       boolean closeIn,
                       boolean closeOut)
                throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: Fetcher
        Copies the content of a given InputStream into a given OutputStream.

        Missing or invalid arguments are handled gracefully with the following behaviour.

        A null is given as an InputStream, it is simply ignored and handled as if there was nothing to read. If closeOut is true, the given OutputStream will be closed anyway

        A null is given as an OutputStream, it is simply ignored, but the content of given InputStream is fetched anyway. If closeIn is true, the given InputStream will be closed anyway

        Specified by:
        copy in interface Fetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        out - The OutputStream to write to.
        listener - The FetchProgressListener to report to.
        closeIn - Whether to close the given InputStream, after reading from it.
        closeOut - Whether to close the given OutputStream, after writing to it.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given InputStream or writing to the given OutputStream. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close one of the given streams, if requested, are ignored.

      • doCopy

        protected abstract void doCopy(InputStream in,
                               OutputStream out,
                               FetchProgressListener listener)
                        throws FetchException
        Copies the content of a given InputStream into a given OutputStream.

        It is guaranteed that neither the given InputStream nor the given OutputStream nor the given FetchProgressListener is null.

        Implementers must not close either of the given streams.

        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        out - The OutputStream to write to.
        listener - The FetchProgressListener to report to.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given InputStream or writing to the given OutputStream.
